   84 yo F with PMH of alzheimer's type dementia, recent hospitalizations
   for PNA and UTI who was admitted following episode of hypoxia and
   cyanosis.
   .
   #Hypoxic respiratory failure - unclear etiology, possible causes
   include flash pulmonary edema given evidence of vascular congestion on
   CXR.  Possible preciptants of pulmonary edema could be hypertension,
   acute myocardial ischemia/infarction, anxiety/agitation.  COPD
   exacerbation also possible and was initial diagnosis in ED, initially
   seemed to respond to nebs in the ED however following developed
   recurrant respiratory distress and was intubated.  Pneumonia is another
   possible cause given question of lower lobe infiltrate on CXR and thick
   secretions suctioned from trach as well as bandemia.  Pulmonary
   embolism is also on the differential however less likely explanation
   than above mentioned causes.  She was intubated in the ED due to
   concern for increased work of breathing and tachypnea/hypoxia.
   -continue to treat for PNA with vancomycin and zosyn (given two recent
   hospitalizaiton, current rehab resident and recent course of
   ciprofloxacin)
   -follow up blood cultures, sputum cultures
   -continue with mechanical ventillation overnight
   -RSBI/SBT in AM
   -check ABG
   -continue with albuterol/atrovent MDI
   -hold off on additional steroids for now as no significant wheezing on
   exam
   .
   #Bandemia - concerning for acute infection, with most likely cause at
   this time either UTI given dirty UA or pneumonia given possible
   infiltrate, hypoxia and thick secretions being suctioned from ET tube.
   On review of recent micro data it appears that her recent morganella
   uti was resistant to ciprofloxacin with which she was treated, which is
   concerning that she could have an untreated UTI as cause of her
   bandemia.
   -continue with vancomycin and zosyn to cover for possible PNA
   -morganella species from recent UTI with intermediate sensitivity to
   zosyn, good sensitivity to ceftriaxone; will consider changing to
   cefepime which would cover pseudomonas and her UTI in AM
   -f/u sputum, blood, urine cultures
   -send C.diff if diarrhea
   .
   #Hypotension - on arrival to ICU blood pressure decreased to SBP 80's -
   90's, however she continued to have good urine output with about
   50-60cc's/hour after getting total of 4L IVF since admission.
   -continue to monitor BP
   -hold off on additional IVF for now given concern for element of
   pulmonary edema
   -monitor urine output (if drops to less than 0.5 cc/kg/hr will consider
   additional IVF vs possibility of SIRS/Sepsis)
   .
   #Dementia/Delirium - she has had progressive decline since her recent
   hospitalization in [**6-13**] with likely superimposed delirium [**3-9**] acute
   medical illness.
   -will hold on her namenda for now
   -reorientation as possible
   .
   #h/o Hypertension - hypotensive on admission with good urine output
   -hold metoprolol
   .
   #Hypernatremia - most likely hypovolemic hypernatremia likely with
   component of free water defecit as well
   -repeat Na after IVF given in ED
   -replete free water with D5 (will hold off on NGT fluids pending

   .

   borderline hypotension
   -continue aspirin (not on coumadin)
   .
